Dear Ms. Fobbs-Walker:
Attached is the Interim Report for the above referenced facility completed on July 14,
2020. Due to the violations of applicable licensing rules, sections of the contract and ISEP
requirements, a written corrective action plan is required. It should be noted that violations
of any licensing rules are also violations of the ISEP and your contract. The corrective
action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the following:
 How compliance with each citation will be achieved.
 Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
licensing statute and rule or section of the contract or ISEP citation.
 Specific time frames for each citation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
 How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
 The signature of the responsible party and a date.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager at (248) 975-5053.
Sincerely,
Deborah Will, Licensing Consultant

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
1.) The facility is in compliance with all applicable licensing statutes and rules except
for the following:
R 400.12404 Placement.
(7) An agency shall document, in the child's record, within 7
calendar days after placement, the information specified in R
400.12417(1) and all of the following information:
(a) All of the following child characteristics:
(iii) Height and weight.
(iv) Eye color and hair color.
(b) Name, known addresses and marital status of the child's
parents or legal guardian, if any.
One of eight initial placement outlines was missing the
child’s height, weight, eye color and hair color.
One of eight initial placement outlines was missing the
names, addresses and marital status of the child’s parents.
R 400.12405 Change of placement.
(3) The agency shall document all of the following in the child's
record before a change of placement occurs:
(a) – (h)
One of three DHS-69b’s which is used to document the
requirements of this rule was not completed before the
change of placement occurred.
(Repeat from 2018 & 2019)
4

R 400.12413 Medical and dental care policy.
(1) An agency's medical and dental care policy shall, at a
minimum, include all of the following:
(c) A physical examination for each child as follows,
unless a greater frequency is medically indicated:
(ii) For a child 2 years of age or older, a physical
examination shall have been completed within 12 months before
placement or a new physical examination shall be completed
within 30 calendar days after placement.
Two of eight physical examinations were not completed
within 30 days after placement.
R 400.12413 Medical and dental care policy.
(1) An agency's medical and dental care policy shall, at a
minimum, include all of the following:
(f) The provision of a dental examination and any treatment
required for each child who is 4 years of age and older,
including both of the following:
(i) A dental examination within 12 months before
placement or a new dental examination shall be completed not
more than 90 calendar days after placement.
One of eight dental examinations was not completed within
90 days after placement.
R 400.12418 Development of service plans.
(2) An agency shall complete written service plans for each child
and parent or parents, as follows:
(b) Within 120 calendar days after the initial removal and at
least once every 90 calendar days thereafter.
5

Four of 24 USPs were not completed within 90 days of the
last service plan. They were completed 3, 10, 11 and 21
days late.
(Repeat from 2019)

ISEP 6.49 Medical Passports updated quarterly and signed by caregiver

there are additional DHHS Contract/Policy requirements that may not be included

FOM 802 pg 1 Mental Health screenings within 30 days of placement
One of eight ASQs was not completed within 30 days
(Repeat from 2019)
FOM 722.06B FTMs completed at least once quarterly
One quarterly FTM was missed for one of eight children
(Repeat from 2018 & 2019)

IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
Foster families are not to be given written corrective action before or unless a rule
violation is cited. Requests for documents from foster parents should be tracked
by the agency and not considered an issue to be corrected by the foster parent
unless the foster parent has already missed deadlines and/or willful non-compliance
has been established.
Check internal policies before citing foster families for not following agency policies
that are more stringent than the foster home rules. Document on the inspection
report or special evaluation the specific Judson Center policy that was not adhered
to if different from the rule.
Foster parent signatures on PATPs should be obtained timely (within 30 days of
the service plan).
V. CONSULTATION
Contacts unrelated to the report should be unlinked in MISACWIS so they do not
show up on the report.
Complete and upload initial placement outlines within 7 days of placement or the
agency receiving the case. Do not upload incomplete initial placement outline or any
other incomplete document. If areas on the IPO are unknown, write unknown.
Do not track Judson Center’s efforts to obtain documents as a title in the uploaded
document section of MISACWIS without obtaining the actual document first. Efforts
obtain documents should be written in the social work contacts.
7

When photos are used to verify facts in SERs, obtain and list the date and time
the photo was taken and include this in the report.
ANALYST’S CONCERNS
There were no analyst safety concerns in foster homes during this licensing
period.
VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
There were no incidents of substantiated child abuse, neglect or corporal
punishment during this licensing period.
There were no DCWL investigations for this agency during this licensing
period.
In the 2019 Renewal Report, the agency was cited and submitted a corrective action
plan for the following citations:
R 400.12205 (8) (b) Required Staff
R 400.12209 (1) Orientation and training (repeat from 2018)
R 400.12212 (2) (b) & (h) Personnel records
R 400.12324 (8) Reevaluation

R 400.12418 (2) (a) & (b) & (3) Development of service plans
FOM 801, pg 1 – Mental Health screening within 30 days
FOM 802, pg 2 – Caseworker role in health documentation
FOM 801, pg 11 – Medical passports to caregivers
FOM 722-06B – Quarterly FTMs (repeat from 2018)
FOM 722-06I, pg 11 – Monthly Sib visits (repeat from 2018)
FOM 722-08C Caregiver signatures on PATPs (repeat from 2018)
SRM 200 – SAT training timeliness (repeat from 2018)
AFPRR Contract – Relative licensure within 1 year
VII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable licensing
statutes and rules and/or MSA requirements and/or contract/policy. Upon receipt of an
acceptable corrective action plan, it is recommended that the facility continue on a
regular license.
